1. The Histogram Module¶

class kea.hist.BPASS_hist¶

Container for the BPASS data to reside and make it possible to perform basic operations on the enclosed data.

This class inherits all function of histogram, but overrides a few to allow for easier manipulation of linear and logarithmic data.

The internal binning is linear in Gyr, but plotting can be done in linear and logarithmic binning.

Fill(x, w=1, ty=None)¶

Adds data to the BPASS histogram

Parameters

  • x (float/array) – Either a single entry or an array of N to put into the histogram

  • w (float/array) – The weight of the entry of N entries to be added to the histogram.

  • ty (string) – The type of input data. Either “log” or “lin”. If none is given, log is assumed

copy()¶

Create a copy of the BPASS histogram

Returns

A copy of the BPASS historam.

Return type

BPASS_hist

getLinBins()¶

Returns the middle points of all bins, except the first bin, which runs from 0 to \(10^{6.05}\), but returns \(10^6\).

Returns

The middle points of all bins in linear space

Return type

array

getLinEdges()¶

Returns the edges in linear space

Returns

The bin edges in linear space

Return type

array

getLogBins()¶

Returns the middle points of all bins, except the first bin, which runs from 0 to \(10^{6.05}\), but returns 6.

Returns

The middle points of all bins in logarithmic space

Return type

array

getLogEdges()¶

Returns the edges in logarithmic space, except for the first bin, where the lowest edge is set to 5.95 instead of 0 for plotting purposes.

Returns

The bin edges in logarithmic space

Return type

array

integral(x1, x2)¶
Returns the integral of the histogram between x1 and x2.

It return an integral in units \(\#events/yr/M_\odot\)

Parameters

  • x1 (float) – lower bound of the integration

  • x2 (float) – upper bound of the integration

Returns

The integral between x1 and x2

Return type

float

plotLin(*argv, **kwargs)¶

Plot the histogram on a linear axis.

plotLog(*argv, **kwargs)¶

Plot the histogram on a logirthmic axis

class kea.hist.histogram(xlow=None, xup=None, nr_bins=None, edges=None)¶

A histogram which can contains data and can be manipulated. Either xlow, xup, and nr_bins is given or edges

As per any histogram, the upper edges are non inclusive, except for the last bin.

Parameters

  • xlow (float) – lower bound

  • xup (float) – upper bound

  • nr_bins (int) – the number of bins

  • edges (array) – An array with items defining the edges.

_xlow¶

lower bound of the histogram

Type

float

_xup¶

upper bound of the histogram

Type

float

_nr_bins¶

the number of bins in the histogram

Type

int

_bin_edges¶

An array of bin edges

Type

array

_values¶

An array of length _nr_bins containing the value of each bin

Type

array

lower_edges¶

An array of the lower edges of the bins in the histogram

Type

array

upper_edges¶

An array of the upper edges of the bins in the histogram

Type

array

Fill(x, w=1)¶

Fill the histogram with data.

Parameters

  • x (float/array) – Either a single entry or an array of N to put into the histogram

  • w (float/array) – The weight of the entry of N entries to be added to the histogram.

Performs a binwise summation between parameters x1 and x2.

Parameters

  • x2 (float) – upper bound of the summation

Returns
